entry.key: Can you add some debug logging
Can you add support here for searlizing flag type enums to and from thing1 | thing2 | thing3 etc
Can you do git commits or is that beyond your capabilities
Can you figure out why TrackingName in Tracker Config is in quotation marks when other strings such as ArgumentTarget in String Config is not?
Can you make SyncEnum able to sync into the config as an unquoted token
Can you reduce the cognitive complexity of MatchesPattern by breaking it up into functions and reuse the currentPattern dict to reduce allocations?
Can you tell me what you think of the entire project
Can you update SyncConfig to match too
Can you update the comment handling on this to instead of putting comments on the same line it puts them on a newline just before and correctly handles both serialization and deserialization
Confirmed it works properly. Do you think you could do something about the overall cognitive complexity in this file?
For me at least I prefer the switch as it's a very clear state machine and it's reasonably clear which value leads to what outcome
How ahrd would it be to parse enums as LaunchMechanism = Mechanical | Connector instead of LaunchMechanism = "Mechanical | Connector"
How does it stack up as far as object notation languages go
I can't figure out what's wrong with my comments. For example, LogLevel here should have a comment before it
I just renamed the Comment class into the FIeld class and I'd like to treat it as the defacto bespoke field object for all fields in the object tree, can you refactor to reflect this?

I think I want an enum to control the state instead. Because the collector will be in multiple states, 1 is currently finding blocks, refreshing etc. 2 is the missile has been collected by the missile manager and it wants to fire, so it should stop being allowed to refresh. 3 is the missile has just fired, so is no longer attached to the ship, so the finder has to forget the current list (it is being used elsewhere so clearing is not an option) and needs to allocate a new one
I think there's an issue here with that. THe previous fix did not fix the issue
I tried to add comment support for both before and inline, can you finalize this and make sure it's working as it should

I'd rather avoid allocations if possible. My idea is to mark an internal flag inside MissileFinder that it has been collected and next time it tries to refresh blocks it needs to create a new list. But also the missile instance itself would need to mark a property inside MIssileFinder saying that it is allowed to recollect after it launches
If I were applying for a job and this was on my resume what position would or should I apply for
Is this switch statement objectively better than the if statmenet I had replaced
It was designed to be an alternative to ini as that's the standard for object notation in space engineers

MissileFinder = [ Offset = Vec3(0 0 0) Extents = Vec3(0 0 0) PayloadType = "Kinetic" # Valid: Kinetic, Warhead, Nuke DeliveryType = "None" # Valid: None | Hydrogen | Ion | Atmospheric LaunchMechanism = "Mechanical | Connector" # Valid: None | Mechanical | Connector | MergeBlock | PulsedThruster | Weapon LaunchControl = "Automatic | Manual | ManualCiwsOverride" # Valid: Automatic, Manual, ManualCiwsOverride RefuelPriority = "Low" # Valid: Low, Medium, High LaunchPulseThrusterName = "null" LaunchWeaponName = "null" ]
Why does it allow options like what i have for LaunchControl? Shouldn't it handle cases like this where distinct states are treated like flags by the user?

Ok I've changed my mind about how I want to do this. Sorry lol I do that a lot. Instead I'm gonna have the construction process do an initial refresh and save a pattern of the missile it detects in its search region, and based on the counts of each block type, the next time it tries to collect it compares to the count of each block type for a match

Ok so a few serialization issues I"d like to fix here:
#1, it has "General Config" twice, instead it should allow mulitple top level configs and drop the main General Config wrapper #2, LogLevel doesn't have a comment saying it's valid values for some reason #3, also to ensure compatability with other scripts it should:
A, prepend the entire config body with "---", this tells SE's MyIni that the content that comes after is not ini config B, if there *is* any other random data in the config, it should be put before the "---"

Okay. So I have this class here which is supposed to essentially be a list of essential blocks on a missile to be able to safely say that the missile is a missile and is thus valid for collection (see MissileFinder.TryCollectBlocks). It obviously needs to interrogate a list of terminal blocks, searching for a thruster, warhead, etc. Although there are multiple types to match, for example a hydrogen thruster means it *needs* a hydrogen tank. The key types that would denote what blocks are needed in the missile are PayloadType and DeliveryType.@<file_name>
Omg you are actually amazing
Some time in the not so distant future I assume?
That's awesome. Is Essentials still the best name for what it does now?
That's perfect I think
Will this return the list that the missile is currently using
